frontMatter.title: Names
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to ask users for their name.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when you need to collect a person's name for contact information or an application.

when_to_use.value: **Collecting personal information.** When you need a person's name for contact purposes, identification, or as part of an application process.

design_principles.value: **Work with stakeholders to determine which fields are necessary.** Not all applications require middle name, suffix, or maiden name.
**Don't restrict character input.** Names can contain special characters, apostrophes, hyphens, and non-ASCII characters.

when_not_to_use.value: **Searching for records.** Use a search pattern instead if you're looking up existing records by name.

examples.title: Default name fields
examples.description: Standard name collection with first, middle, and last name fields.
examples.alt: Form showing first name, middle name, and last name text input fields

how_to_build.intro: The name pattern uses standard text input components with specific validation and labeling requirements.

steps.value: First name and last name are required fields. Middle name is optional.
Suffix (Jr., Sr., III, etc.) uses a select dropdown and is optional.
Mother's maiden name is optional and only included when specifically required for identity verification.
Name fields should typically appear on the same page as date of birth for identification purposes.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The `fullNamePattern` is available as a web-component pattern in the VA Forms library.

```jsx
import { fullNamePattern } from '@department-of-veterans-affairs/platform-forms-system/patterns';
```

See the [Forms library documentation](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/developer-docs/va-forms-library-overview) for implementation details.

content_considerations.value: Use 'First or given name' and 'Last or family name' as labels to be inclusive of different naming conventions.
Do not restrict the length of name fields unnecessarily. Some names can be quite long.
Allow special characters including apostrophes, hyphens, and periods.

content_specs.error_message: Enter a first or given name
You entered a character we can't accept. Try removing the character or entering your name differently.
Enter a last or family name
You entered a character we can't accept. Try removing the character or entering your name differently.

accessibility.value: Ensure each name field has a visible, associated label.
Use autocomplete attributes: `autocomplete='given-name'` for first name, `autocomplete='family-name'` for last name.
Error messages should be associated with the field using `aria-describedby`.
